Title: Misleading comments
Content:
The code base contains several misleading comments:


* The `collectRewardTokens` function of the `BaseConvexMetaStrategy` contract [claims](https://github.com/OriginProtocol/origin-dollar/blob/bfe0ac8e5d7c05b9bf1021fafb25e0aed8a6ed45/contracts/contracts/strategies/BaseConvexMetaStrategy.sol#L190) to send rewards to the vault, but it sends them to the `harvester` address.
* The `depositAll` function of the `BaseCurveStrategy` contract [does not accurately describe](https://github.com/OriginProtocol/origin-dollar/blob/bfe0ac8e5d7c05b9bf1021fafb25e0aed8a6ed45/contracts/contracts/strategies/BaseCurveStrategy.sol#L92-L93) how all descendant contracts retrieve the 3CRV token address.
* The [comment](https://github.com/OriginProtocol/origin-dollar/blob/bfe0ac8e5d7c05b9bf1021fafb25e0aed8a6ed45/contracts/contracts/strategies/ConvexOUSDMetaStrategy.sol#L57-L62) explaining how much OUSD to add in the `ConvexOUSDMetaStrategy` states that it could mint less OUSD if the metapool has too much, but it always adds [at least as much OUSD as 3CRV](https://github.com/OriginProtocol/origin-dollar/blob/bfe0ac8e5d7c05b9bf1021fafb25e0aed8a6ed45/contracts/contracts/strategies/ConvexOUSDMetaStrategy.sol#L54). Moreover, it claims the metapool will end up balanced. However it [won’t add more than twice as much OUSD](https://github.com/OriginProtocol/origin-dollar/blob/bfe0ac8e5d7c05b9bf1021fafb25e0aed8a6ed45/contracts/contracts/strategies/ConvexOUSDMetaStrategy.sol#L55) (by value) than 3CRV, even if that’s necessary to balance the metapool.
* The `mintForStrategy` function of the `VaultCore` contract [claims](https://github.com/OriginProtocol/origin-dollar/blob/bfe0ac8e5d7c05b9bf1021fafb25e0aed8a6ed45/contracts/contracts/vault/VaultCore.sol#L115-L116) that it cannot use the `nonReentrant` modifier because it clashes with the `BaseCurveStrategy` contract’s modifier. However, the two modifiers do not interact with each other. Instead, it is the `nonReentrant` modifier on the [`allocate` function](https://github.com/OriginProtocol/origin-dollar/blob/bfe0ac8e5d7c05b9bf1021fafb25e0aed8a6ed45/contracts/contracts/vault/VaultCore.sol#L286) that would cause the conflict.
* The [`@param` comment](https://github.com/OriginProtocol/origin-dollar/blob/bfe0ac8e5d7c05b9bf1021fafb25e0aed8a6ed45/contracts/contracts/strategies/ConvexOUSDMetaStrategy.sol#L98) describing the `_lpWithdraw` function of the `ConvexOUSDMetaStrategy` contract claims it is the number of Convex LP tokens to redeem, but it is the number of 3CRV tokens to retrieve.


Consider correcting these comments.


**Update:** *Fixed in [commit `4b7f103658656a16d160231f96f36ac1d4336dfd`](https://github.com/OriginProtocol/origin-dollar/commit/4b7f103658656a16d160231f96f36ac1d4336dfd) and [commit `d7ddbb3a2c261ed600d99bc73377de53b4859ad5`](https://github.com/OriginProtocol/origin-dollar/commit/d7ddbb3a2c261ed600d99bc73377de53b4859ad5).*
